components.label: HTML
components.tag: h2 style="font-weight:bold; margin-top:0px; font-family: Source Sans Pro Web,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,Roboto,Arial,sans-serif;"
components.content: Why do you believe someone discriminated against you?

components.label: HTML
components.tag: h3 style="font-weight:300; margin-top:15px; margin-bottom:15px; font-family: Source Sans Pro Web,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,Roboto,Arial,sans-serif;"
components.content: Choose at least one reason. You can choose more than one.

components.label: HTML
components.content:
The federal Fair Housing Act bans discrimination in housing based on seven characteristics. These are called protected classes.

  1. Race
    2. The U.S. Census Bureau defines these racial categories in the United States:
    • White
    • Black or African American
    • Asian
    • American Indian or Alaska Native
    • Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
    • a mixture of two or more of these groups

  2. Color
    • Color refers to your skin color or tone
    • Within a race, skin color can vary significantly. People of the same race can discriminate against each other based on color.

  3. Religion
    • Religion refers to your practice (or non-practice) of a religion
    • Examples: Hinduism, Judaism, Islam, Christianity

  4. Sex
    • Sex refers to your gender, gender identity, or sexual orientation
    • It also includes sexual harassment

  5. National origin (ancestry or ethnicity)
    • National origin refers to your birthplace, ethnicity, ancestry, or culture
    • It also includes language, such as speaking with an accent or speaking a language other than English

    NOTE: The federal Fair Housing Act protects all U.S. residents, regardless of citizenship status. We will not ask about your citizenship status, and we will not share any information about you to immigration authorities.

  6. Disability
    • Disability refers to a mental or physical impairment that substantially limits one or more of your major life activities
    • Major life activities include actions like seeing, hearing, speaking, walking, breathing, performing manual tasks, caring for oneâ€™s self, or working

  7. Familial status (families with children under 18 years old)
    • Familial status refers to having a child under 18 years old in your household
    • It also includes women who are pregnant and families adopting children
components.tag: p

components.label: Why do you believe someone discriminated against you
Because of my race or skin color
Because of my national origin (ancestry or ethnicity)
Because of my sex, gender identity, or sexual orientation or because I was sexually harassed
Because I have family with children under 18 years old or I am pregnant, a foster parent, or adopting children

components.label: Date

validate.customMessage: Please enter a date within the last year. By law, we can only investigate discrimination that happened in the last year. If the last date you experienced discrimination was more than a year ago, call your nearest HUD fair housing office for more information.

components.errorLabel: A date within the last year
